hotspots.label: Holstein Dairy Cow
hotspots.fact: The black and white cow is a Holstein, one of the most common dairy breeds in the world. Holsteins can produce up to 6 gallons of milk per day, making them very valuable for farms!

hotspots.label: White Beef Cattle
hotspots.fact: These white cows are likely beef cattle breeds like Charolais. Unlike dairy cows, beef cattle are raised primarily for meat rather than milk production.

hotspots.label: Forest Ecosystem
hotspots.fact: The dense forest behind the pasture provides shade, shelter, and windbreaks for the cattle. Forests also help clean the air and provide habitats for many other animals and plants.

hotspots.label: Pasture Grazing Land
hotspots.fact: The green grass is a natural food source for cattle. Grazing on pasture helps cattle stay healthy and allows them to exercise, which is better than keeping them in barns all day.
